wikipedia_page.main:
Ronald E. Brown (born 26 December 1944) is an English retired footballer who played for Blackpool, Plymouth Argyle and Bradford City. He was born in Sunderland.
After retiring from playing, he moved into management, beginning with Peterhead.

link_mentions.page: List of Bradford City A.F.C. players

response: Season 1968–69 saw Mortensen move Rowe into a forward position for part of the season. It seemed to work, as he finished third-top scorer behind Alan Suddick and Ronnie Brown with six goals. This included a hat-trick in a 6–0 whitewash of Bury at Bloomfield Road on 23 November 1968.
Ronnie Brown (born 1981) is an American football player.
